com.hippikon.security
Class DefaultObjectPolicy

java.lang.Object
  com.hippikon.security.Policy
      com.hippikon.security.DefaultObjectPolicy
public class DefaultObjectPolicy
extends Policy

The DefaultObjectPolicy class provides a mechanism to handle simple authorization based on the the roles assigned to a user. The role permissions must be defined in a PolicyStore implementation.

The policy does not use any user principal logic and is provided as a catch-all policy for ProtectedResource objects that have not beed defined in the resource.policies file for a product.

Since:
JDK 1.2.2
Version:
$Id: DefaultObjectPolicy.html,v 1.1.1.1 2005/06/20 21:00:49 dalehippikon Exp $
Author:
Dale Churchett

Constructor Detail

DefaultObjectPolicy

public DefaultObjectPolicy(ProtectedResource res,
                           AuthorizationContext ctx)
                    throws IllegalAuthorizationException
Creates a new DefaultObjectPolicy to handle simple authorization based on the roles the user has been assigned within a protected application.

Parameters:
res - the ProtectedResource being accessed. This constructor is required as part of the DefaultObjectPolicy contract.
ctx - the AuthorizationContext the ProtectedResource is being accessed within.
Throws:
IllegalAuthorizationException - thrown if an illegal access attempt was made by a user.
